definitions.text: a wooden strip forming part of a fence
turn pale, as if in fear
very light colored; highly diluted with white
(of light) lacking in intensity or brightness; dim or feeble
examples: the pale light of a half moon
the late afternoon light coming through the el tracks fell in pale oblongs on the street

definitions.text: lacking in vitality or interest or effectiveness
examples: a pale rendition of the aria
pale prose with the faint sweetness of lavender

definitions.text: abnormally deficient in color as suggesting physical or emotional distress
examples: the pallid face of the invalid
high, pale, pure and lovely song
